name: places/ChIJybmTnQv2wokRRMgMylEqEu4
formattedAddress: 30 E 125th St, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 30 E 125th St, New York, NY 10035, USA

editorialSummary.text: Store offering shipping, packaging, printing & other services, plus office supplies.

originalText.text:
Dominic, Adrian and Kay were extremely helpful. I can understand why there may be frustration-many customers come here without being prepared and expect the staff to magically provide customer service and fulfill order requests. Especially for Amazon based returns. Amazon needs to streamline the returns process and UPS needs to better equip its staff to deal with customers that do not have what's needed to ship or retrieve parcels.

Overall a great experience. Will be Mt primary choice for my shipping needs regarding UPS.

originalText.text: This is my first time getting my packages sent to a UPS Store.  The worker I spoke to a Kay was very rude and inappropriate.  On the emails I received that my packages are ready they only said ID needs to be presented, the worker said it was the tracking numbers that needed to be presented that is contradictory.  Then he proceeds under his breath to call my mother a derogatory name which was very rude because they had an argument.  He went to turn up the music playing and proceeded to sing while I was talking to him.  He was very dismissive when I wanted to ask a question.  I will never come here nor recommend this place to anyone.  Dear owner if you continue to hire people like this you will constantly get bad reviews.

originalText.text: If I could leave zero stars that would be more appropriate! The cashier (Kay is the name on the receipt) was extremely unprofessional and rude. He walked away from the counter in the middle of my return and proceeded to ignore me. I was charged to tape two small boxes together since Amazon only generated one label for the two items. I will do everything to avoid this location until they improve their staff training.

text.text: If I could leave zero stars that would be more appropriate! The cashier (Kay is the name on the receipt) was extremely unprofessional and rude. originalText.text: Horrendous customer service. I came into the store with my dog to drop something off. The guy at the desk went off on me for bringing my dog in without carrying her. I apologized but said I was only dropping something. He then told me he would deny me service next time if I did this again. I said I wouldn’t return. He went off, saying great that I wouldn’t return and how I completely disrespected him by not following the rules. A full five minute diatribe before he threw my package into a pile. I get that I should have followed the rules but I wasn’t aware beforehand and the reaction was so extreme as to turn me off from ever going back.

He went off, saying great that I wouldn’t return and how I completely disrespected him by not following the rules. A full five minute diatribe before he threw my package into a pile. I get that I should have followed the rules but I wasn’t aware beforehand and the reaction was so extreme as to turn me off from ever going back.

originalText.text: I had a 5 star experience at this store and would like to give a shout out to Jennifer and Steven. On 9/9/23 I shipped 3 boxes to Austin, Texas from this store, and unfortunately the boxes were not delivered (due to the address initially missing an apartment #), and were returned to sender- the UPS store in NYC!  Jennifer and Steven fielded  numerous calls from me about where the boxes were before they turned up at the store (I was pretty panicky about the boxes' whereabouts) and they negotiated with UPS for me that I would not have to pay for the boxes to be shipped a second time to Texas. When only 2 of the three boxes showed up at the store, Jennifer checked in the UPS system to try to track down the 3rd box. She sent out the first two boxes, and when the 3rd box finally showed up (almost a week after the first two) this was shipped as well. Thanks again to Jennifer & Steven at UPS Store #6166 for all your help!
